ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Allah, the Everlasting Sustainer of all.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Allah, Who is in need of none and of Whom all are in need;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Allah is the Un-wanting.” (Perfect, does not require anything.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Allah is He on Whom all depend.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Allah, the eternally Besought of all!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Allah-us-Samad (The Self-Sufficient Master, Whom all creatures need, He neither eats nor drinks).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [112:2] God, the Self-Sufficient, Besought of all (Allāhu’l-samad constitute a subject and a predicate) [al-samad means] the One Who is always sought at times of need,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Allah, the eternally Besought of all!) the Master whose glory is at its peak and for Whom all created beings are in need; it is also said that (al-Samad) means: He Who does not eat or drink; it is also said that this means: He Who does not have an interior; it is also said that this means: the Everlasting; and it is also said this means: the Sufficient; and it is also said this means: He who does not have an entrance or exit.
